intro: Filago bianorii, commonly known as the Bianorii filago, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a distinctive coloration that varies depending on the season. Filago bianorii is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological adaptations.
